alert.note: Alert for Central Blue Mountains; Central Mountains of Oregon; Deschutes National Forest - minus Sisters Ranger District; Southern Blue and Strawberry Mountains; Wallowa District (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 01 at 9:23PM PDT until August 04 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... .The ridge to our east will tighten allowing for instability to move into the region. A monsoonal push of mid level moisture will also surge into the region increasing the chances for thunderstorms on Thursday. With the prolonged warm and dry conditions, the chances of abundant lightning increases the risk for new fire starts, especially along the eastern portion of the region. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES OR611, OR640, OR642, OR644, AND OR645... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 611 Deschutes National Forest -minus Sisters Ranger District, 640 Central Mountains of Oregon, 642 Southern Blue and Strawberry Mountains, 644 Central Blue Mountains and 645 Wallowa District. * IMPACTS...Thunderstorms could start new fires, especially in dry fuel beds. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Out flow winds could cause erratic fire behavior on pre existing fires.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Central Blue Mountains; Central Mountains of Oregon; Deschutes National Forest - minus Sisters Ranger District; Southern Blue and Strawberry Mountains; Wallowa District
